translations.name: The Bible Project
translations.description_short: The Bible Project is a non-profit animation studio that produces short-form, fully animated videos to make the biblical story accessible to everyone, everywhere.

translations.title: Read Scripture - 01 Intro
translations.description: In 2016 we released a new Read Scripture video for every book of the Bible coordinated with our reading plan. If you haven't read through the Bible before, or if you have tried and given up, we encourage you to read through with us.

translations.title: Read Scripture - 02 Genesis 1-11
translations.description: God makes a good world and commissions humans to rule it, and then they give in to evil and ruin everything.

translations.title: Read Scripture - 03 Genesis 12-50
translations.description: God promises to bless rebellious humanity through the family of Abraham, despite their constant failure and folly.

translations.title: Read Scripture - 04 Exodus 1-18
translations.description: God rescues the Israelites from slavery in Egypt and confronts the evil and injustice of Pharaoh.

translations.title: Read Scripture - 05 Exodus 19-40
translations.description: God invites the Israelites into a covenant and comes to live among them in the Tabernacle, but Israel rebels and ruins the relationship.

translations.title: Read Scripture - 06 Leviticus
translations.description: Israel’s holy God invites them to live in His presence despite their sin, through a series of rituals and sacred institutions.

translations.title: Read Scripture - 07 Numbers
translations.description: Israel travels through the wilderness on the way to the land promised to Abraham. Their repeated rebellion is met by God’s justice and mercy.

translations.title: Read Scripture - 08 Deuteronomy
translations.description: Moses gives final words of wisdom and warning before the Israelites enter the promised land, challenging them to be faithful to God.

translations.title: Read Scripture - 09 Joshua
translations.description: After Moses' death, Joshua leads Israel and they settle in the promised land currently occupied by Canaanites.

translations.title: Read Scripture - 10 Judges
translations.description: The Israelites turn away from God and face the consequences. God raises judges in cycles of rebellion, repentance, and restoration.

translations.title: Read Scripture - 11 Ruth
translations.description: An Israelite family faces tragic loss, and God uses the faithfulness of a non-Israelite woman to bring restoration into the family of David.

translations.title: Read Scripture - 12 1 Samuel
translations.description: God reluctantly raises up kings to rule the Israelites. The first is a failure, and the second, David, is a faithful replacement.

translations.title: Read Scripture - 13 2 Samuel
translations.description: David becomes God's most faithful king, but then rebels, resulting in the slow destruction of his family and kingdom.

translations.title: Read Scripture - 14 1-2 Kings
translations.description: David’s son Solomon leads Israel to greatness, only to fail and lead Israel to a civil war and ultimately towards destruction and exile.

translations.title: Read Scripture - 15 1-2 Chronicles
translations.description: Chronicles retells the entire Old Testament story, highlighting the future hope of the messianic king and a restore temple.

translations.title: Read Scripture - 16 Ezra-Nehemiah
translations.description: Many Israelites return to Jerusalem after the exile, and face some success alongside many spiritual and moral failures.

translations.title: Read Scripture - 17 Esther
translations.description: God providentially uses two exiled Israelites to rescue His people from certain doom, without any explicit mention of God or His activity!

translations.title: Read Scripture - 18 Job
translations.description: Job explores the difficult question of God's relationship to human suffering, and invites us to trust God's wisdom and character.

translations.title: Read Scripture - 19 Psalms
translations.description: The book of Psalms has been designed to be the prayer book of God's people as they wait for the Messiah and his coming kingdom.

translations.title: Read Scripture - 20 Proverbs
translations.description: The book of Proverbs invites people to live with wisdom and in the fear of the Lord in order to experience the good life.

translations.title: Read Scripture - 21 Ecclesiastes
translations.description: This book forces us to face death and random chance, and the challenges they pose to a naive belief in God’s goodness.

translations.title: Read Scripture - 22 Song of Songs
translations.description: The Song of Songs is a collection of ancient Israelite love poems that celebrates the beauty and power of God's gift of love and sexual desire.

translations.title: Read Scripture - 23 Isaiah 1-39
translations.description: Isaiah announces that God’s judgment will purify Israel and prepare his people to the coming messianic king and new Jerusalem.

translations.title: Read Scripture - 24 Isaiah 40-66
translations.description: Isaiah announces that God’s judgment will purify Israel and prepare his people to the coming messianic king and new Jerusalem.

translations.title: Read Scripture - 25 Jeremiah
translations.description: Jeremiah announces that God will judge Israel’s sins with an exile to Babylon. And then, he lives through the horror of his predictions.

translations.title: Read Scripture - 26 Lamentations
translations.description: A collection of five funeral poems offered on behalf of Jerusalem after its destruction by Babylon.

translations.title: Read Scripture - 27 Ezekiel 1-33
translations.description: Among the exiles in Babylon, Ezekiel shows that Israel deserved this judgment, and also that God’s justice creates hope for the future.

translations.title: Read Scripture - 28 Ezekiel 34-48
translations.description: Among the exiles in Babylon, Ezekiel shows that Israel deserved this judgment, and also that God’s justice creates hope for the future.

translations.title: Read Scripture - 29 Daniel
translations.description: The story of Daniel motivates faithfulness despite exile in Babylon. His visions offer hope that God will bring all nations under his rule.

translations.title: Read Scripture - 30 Hosea
translations.description: Hosea accuses Israel of breaking their covenant with God, and warns them of the tragic consequences to follow.

translations.title: Read Scripture - 31 Joel
translations.description: Joel reflects on the \"Day of the Lord\" and how true repentance will bring about the great restoration hoped for in the other prophetic books.

translations.title: Read Scripture - 32 Amos
translations.description: Amos accuses Israel of breaking their covenant with God, and highlights how their idolatry has led to injustice and the neglect of the poor.

translations.title: Read Scripture - 33 Obadiah
translations.description: Obadiah announces Edom's downfall to Babylon, which is an image of how God will bring down all arrogant and violent nations.

translations.title: Read Scripture - 34 Jonah
translations.description: A subversive story about a rebellious prophet who despises his God for loving his enemies.

translations.title: Read Scripture - 35 Micah
translations.description: Micah announces that God's justice is coming in order to create a new future of love and faithfulness on the other side of Israel's sin and exile.

translations.title: Read Scripture - 36 Nahum
translations.description: Nahum portrays the downfall of Nineveh and Assyria as an image of how God will confront and bring down all violent human empires.

translations.title: Read Scripture - 37 Habakkuk
translations.description: Habakkuk struggles to understand God's goodness in the midst of such evil and injustice in the world.

translations.title: Read Scripture - 38 Zephaniah
translations.description: Zephaniah announces God’s purifying judgment on Israel. It will remove evil and open up a new future where all people can flourish in peace.

translations.title: Read Scripture - 39 Haggai
translations.description: Haggai challenges Israel after the exile to remain faithful to their God and rebuild the temple.

translations.title: Read Scripture - 40 Zechariah
translations.description: Zechariah's visions foster hope in the future promise of the messianic kingdom, and challenge Israel after the exile to remain faithful to God.

translations.title: Read Scripture - 41 Malachi
translations.description: Malachi accuses Israel of selfishness after the exile and announces that the day of the Lord will purify Israel and prepare them for God's kingdom.

translations.title: Read Scripture - 42 Matthew 1-13
translations.description: Jesus brings God’s heavenly kingdom to earth and invites his disciples into a new way of life through his death and resurrection.

translations.title: Read Scripture - 43 Matthew 14-28
translations.description: Jesus brings God’s heavenly kingdom to earth and invites his disciples into a new way of life through his death and resurrection.

translations.title: Read Scripture - 44 Mark
translations.description: Mark demonstrates that Jesus is Israel's messiah who inaugurates God’s kingdom through his suffering, death, and resurrection.

translations.title: Read Scripture - 45 Luke 1-9
translations.description: Jesus carries the covenant story of God and Israel to its culmination and he announces the good news of God’s kingdom to the poor and the rich.

translations.title: Read Scripture - 46 Luke 10-24
translations.description: Jesus carries the covenant story of God and Israel to its culmination and he announces the good news of God’s kingdom to the poor and the rich.

translations.title: Read Scripture - 47 John 1-12
translations.description: Jesus becomes human as the incarnation of the creator God of Israel, to share His love and the gift of eternal life with the world.

translations.title: Read Scripture - 48 John 13-21
translations.description: Jesus becomes human as the incarnation of the creator God of Israel, to share His love and the gift of eternal life with the world.

translations.title: Read Scripture - 49 Acts 1-12
translations.description: Jesus sends the Holy Spirit to empower his disciples as they carry the good news of his kingdom to the nations of the world.

translations.title: Read Scripture - 50 Acts 13-28
translations.description: Jesus sends the Holy Spirit to empower his disciples as they carry the good news of his kingdom to the nations of the world.

translations.title: Read Scripture - 51 Romans 1-4
translations.description: Paul shows how Jesus created the new covenant family of Abraham through his death and resurrection and the sending of the Spirit.

translations.title: Read Scripture - 52 Romans 5-16
translations.description: Paul shows how Jesus created the new covenant family of Abraham through his death and resurrection and the sending of the Spirit.

translations.title: Read Scripture - 53 Paul's First Letter to the Corinthians
translations.description: Paul shows the new Christians in Corinth that all of life's most complex problems can be seen through the lens of the gospel.

translations.title: Read Scripture - 54 2 Corinthians
translations.description: Paul resolves his conflict with the Corinthians by showing how the scandal of the crucifixion turns our value systems upside-down.

translations.title: Read Scripture - 55 Galatians
translations.description: Paul challenges the Galatian Christians to stop allowing controversial Torah observances to divide their church's congregation.

translations.title: Read Scripture - 56 Ephesians
translations.description: Paul shows how the good news should create ethnically diverse communities that are unified by devotion to Jesus and to each other.

translations.title: Read Scripture - 57 Philippians
translations.description: Paul thanks the Philippian Christians for their generosity and shares how they are all called to imitate Jesus’ self-giving love.

translations.title: Read Scripture - 58 Colossians
translations.description: Paul encourages the Colossian Christians to see Jesus as the center of all reality, so they don’t give in to pressure from other religions.

translations.title: Read Scripture - 59 1 Thessalonians
translations.description: Paul directs the persecuted Thessalonian Christians to hope in the future of king Jesus' return who will make all things right.

translations.title: Read Scripture - 60 2 Thessalonians
translations.description: Paul clarified his earlier teachings about Jesus' future return and rebukes the Christians who were disrupting the community.

translations.title: Read Scripture - 61 1 Timothy
translations.description: Paul shows Timothy how to restore order and purpose to the church in Ephesus which has been disrupted by false teachers.

translations.title: Read Scripture - 62 2 Timothy
translations.description: Paul is near execution, and offers a personal challenge to Timothy to keeping following Jesus no matter the sacrifice and risk.

translations.title: Read Scripture - 63 Titus
translations.description: Paul commissions Titus to show how the good news of Jesus and the power of the Spirit can transform Cretan culture from within.

translations.title: Read Scripture - 64 Philemon
translations.description: Paul helps his friend Philemon to reconcile with his escaped former slave Onesimus, and shows that they are equals because of Jesus.

translations.title: Read Scripture - 65 Letter to the Hebrews
translations.description: The author shows how Jesus is the ultimate revelation of God's love and mercy and is worthy of our devotion.

translations.title: Read Scripture - 66 James
translations.description: James combines the wisdom of his brother Jesus with the book of Proverbs in his own challenging call to live a life wholly devoted to God.

translations.title: Read Scripture - 67 1 Peter
translations.description: Peter offers hope to persecuted Christians and guides them with practical instruction on living life consistent with following Jesus.

translations.title: Read Scripture - 68 2 Peter
translations.description: Peter calls for faithfulness and confronts corrupt teachers who distorted the message about Jesus and lead others astray.

translations.title: Read Scripture - 69 1-3 John
translations.description: John calls followers of Jesus to share in God's own life and love by devoting themselves to loving one another.

translations.title: Read Scripture - 70 Jude
translations.description: Jude confronts corrupt teachers who distort the message about his brother Jesus and lead others astray.

translations.title: Read Scripture - 71 Revelation 1-11
translations.description: John's visions reveal that Jesus has overcome evil by his death and resurrection, and will return one day as the true king of the world.

translations.title: Read Scripture - 72 Revelation 12-22
translations.description: John's visions reveal that Jesus has overcome evil by his death and resurrection, and will return one day as the true king of the world.

translations.title: Read the Bible - 01 What is the Bible?
translations.description: This is episode 1 of an ongoing series that explores the origins, content, and purpose of the Bible. Here you'll be introduced to some of the basic skills necessary for reading the bible effectively.

translations.title: Read the Bible - 02 The Story of the Bible
translations.description: In this video we summarize the overall story of the Bible as a series of crossroad decisions. All humanity, followed by the Israelites, redefine good and evil and end up in Babylon. They are followed by Jesus, who takes a different path that opens up the way to a new creation.

translations.title: Read the Bible - 03 Literary Styles in the Bible
translations.description: Reading the Bible wisely requires that we learn about the ancient literary styles used by the biblical authors. These writers expressed their ideas and claims through a variety of different type of literature, and this video will explore why it's important to tell them apart so we can hear their message on their terms.

translations.title: Read the Bible - 04 The Bible as Jewish Meditation Literature
translations.description: Reading the Bible wisely requires that we learn about the ancient literary styles used by the biblical authors. The Bible is a dense book that is often difficult to read. But what if the very features that make it challenging are actually invitations to a lifetime of meditation? In this video we'll see how the Bible is the original meditation literature.

translations.title: Read the Bible - 05 Plot in Biblical Narrative
translations.description: An important part of reading biblical narratives is learning how to understand the nature of \"the plot,\" how stories are arranged into a pattern of conflict and resolution. In this video we'll see how ignoring the sequence of the plot can lead to distorted interpretation of biblical stories. We'll also explore how grasping the multi-layered nature of the narrative can help you see the unified story that leads to Jesus.

translations.title: Torah Series -01 The Book of Genesis Overview - Part 1 of 2
translations.description: The Book of Genesis can be broken up in two parts. The first part, chapters 1-11, trace the story of God and the whole world from creation all the way to the tower of Babel.

translations.title: Torah Series -02 The Book of Genesis Overview - Part 2 of 2
translations.description: God makes a promise to a man named Abram that all nations of the earth will be blessed through his family. The second half of the book of Genesis follows this man's family for four generations.

translations.title: Torah Series -03 The Book of Exodus Overview - Part 1 of 2
translations.description: The Book the first half of the book of Exodus is the story of Moses leading Israel out of Egypt. It is the first place the words \"Redemption\" and \"Salvation\" are used in the Bible. Find out how this epic story fits into the entire Biblical Narrative.

translations.title: Torah Series -04 The Book of Exodus Overview - Part 2 of 2
translations.description: In the 2nd half of Exodus Israel meets God at Mt. Sinai. They make a covenant with him, receive rules by which to live, build a tabernacle where God will dwell with them, but things go terribly wrong.

translations.title: Torah Series -05 The Book of Leviticus Overview
translations.description: Leviticus is difficult to read, but its core message is amazing: God graciously provides a way for sinful, broken people to live near his holy presence so they can find wholeness and life.

translations.title: Torah Series -06 The Book of Numbers
translations.description: The book of Numbers is Israel's epic road trip through the wilderness on their way to the promised land.

translations.title: Torah Series -07 The Book of Deuteronomy
translations.description: Moses delivers his final words of warning and wisdom to the Israelites before they enter the promised land. This is the epic conclusion of the Torah! And, spoiler alert: Moses dies.

translations.title: Gospel Series - 01 The Gospel According to Mark
translations.description: One of the earliest official accounts of the life, death, and resurrection of Jesus. Mark addresses the basic questions of whether Jesus was the true messiah for whom Israel had been waiting. And if so, what kind of Messianic king was he if he suffered and died?

translations.title: Gospel Series - 02 The Birth of Jesus - Gospel of Luke Ch 1-2
translations.description: The first in a five-part series on the Gospel of Luke. We explore the amazing events surrounding the birth of Jesus. The humble conditions of his family and their low status in Israelite society foreshadow the upside-down nature of Jesus’ kingdom.

translations.title: Gospel Series - 03 Gospel of Luke Ch. 3-9
translations.description: The Gospel of Luke Part 2 (ch. 3-9): Jesus begins his mission of announcing the good news of God’s kingdom to the poor among Israel. He is identified as the royal son of God at the beginning and end of this section, and then he starts his journey to Jerusalem where he will be enthroned as king, but not in the way anyone expects.

translations.title: Gospel Series - 04 Gospel of Luke Ch. 9-19
translations.description: In this video we explore the central part of Luke’s Gospel which recounts Jesus’ long road-trip to Jerusalem. He continues his controversial announcement of good news for the poor, which increases his conflict with Israel’s religious leaders. This tension provides the setting for the famous parable of the Prodigal Son in which Jesus summarizes what he is all about.

translations.title: Gospel Series - 05 Gospel of Luke Ch. 19-23
translations.description: The final week of Jesus' life culminated in a controversial week in Jerusalem during Passover. In this video we'll explore the Gospel of Luke chs. 19-23, and how it came about that the innocent Jesus ended up being executed as a revolutionary rebel against Rome. We'll also see how Jesus was not at all surprised, because he believed that his death would open up a new future for Israel, and for all humanity.

translations.title: Gospel Series - 06 Luke Ch. 24
translations.description: This video concludes Luke's epic portrait of Jesus of Nazareth. The disciples discover the empty tomb and eventually have their entire view of the world turned upside-down as they meet the risen Jesus. Luke shows how Jesus' kingdom of God mission to its climactic moment, and he sets the stage for its continuation in Luke's second volume, Acts.

translations.title: Wisdom Series - 01 The Book of Proverbs
translations.description: This book is the accumulation of wisdom from generations of godly insightful people. It promotes a life of virtue and “fear of the Lord,” so that you can truly experience the good life. Proverbs is one of the three books that explore these themes of biblical wisdom.

translations.title: Wisdom Series - 02 The Book of Ecclesiastes
translations.description: In this book we hear the skeptical voice of “the teacher.” He observes that living by the book of Proverbs doesn’t always bring positive results. Sometimes life is hard and defies neat explanations. How do you live with that tension, and still strive for wisdom? Ecclesiastes is the second of the biblical wisdom books.

translations.title: Wisdom Series - 03 The Book of Job
translations.description: How do you trust God even when life isn’t fair and you suffer for no good reason? Job’s story invites us to consider what it means that God runs the world by wisdom, and how this truth can bring peace in dark times. Job is the last of the three books that explore these themes of biblical wisdom.

translations.title: Themes - 01 Covenants
translations.description: God entered into a series of formal relationships with various human partners in order to ultimately rescue the world through Jesus.

translations.title: Themes - 02 Day of the Lord
translations.description: The Day of the Lord explores how God is on a mission to confront human evil, and the more mysterious spiritual evil that underlies it.

translations.title: Themes - 03 Gospel of the Kingdom
translations.description: Jesus brought God’s rule and reign to the world in a very upside-down way, which is the best news you could ever hope to hear.

translations.title: Themes - 04 Heaven & Earth
translations.description: Heaven and earth were meant to overlap, and Jesus is on a mission to bring them together once and for all.

translations.title: Themes - 05 Holiness
translations.description: The holy God is unique and set-apart as the Creator of all reality. And this God wants to invite all people into his purifying holiness so they can experience true life.

translations.title: Themes - 06 Holy Spirit
translations.description: God’s Spirit is personally present in all of creation and is sent out to Jesus' followers to bring about the new creation.

translations.title: Themes - 07 Image of God
translations.description: Jesus opens up a new way of being the image bearers of God through his life, death, and resurrection.

translations.title: Themes - 08 The Law
translations.description: The laws in the Old Testament are part of the Bible’s larger story that leads to Jesus. In him we are freed from our own selfishness to love God and our neighbor.

translations.title: Themes - 09 The Messiah
translations.description: Jesus fulfilled the ancient biblical promise of a wounded victor who would rescue humanity. He was the one who overcame evil itself by allowing it to destroy him.

translations.title: Themes - 10 Sacrifice & Atonement
translations.description: God’s “covering” over human evil through animal sacrifices ultimately point to Jesus and his death and resurrection.

translations.title: Themes - 11 Public Reading of Scripture
translations.description: Reading the Bible out loud is an ancient practice that offers us an example for a different way of engaging the Scriptures.

translations.title: Themes - 12 Justice
translations.description: What is justice and who gets to define it? Explore the biblical theme of Justice and discover how it's deeply rooted in the storyline of the Bible that leads to Jesus.

translations.title: Shema Series - 01 Listen
translations.description: The first installment of our new Word Studies series is a six-part exploration of the ancient biblical prayer called “The Shema” (found in Deuteronomy 6:4-6). For thousands of years Jewish people have daily prayed these words which summarize the Bible’s call for faithfulness and devotion to God. We will explore all of the key words in this prayer and what they meant in their original language and historical context.

translations.title: Shema Series - 02 YHWH / LORD
translations.description: The second installment of our Word Studies series is a six-part exploration of the ancient biblical prayer called “The Shema” (found in Deuteronomy 6:4-6). For thousands of years Jewish people have daily prayed these words which summarize the Bible’s call for faithfulness and devotion to God. We will explore all of the key words in this prayer and what they meant in their original language and historical context.

translations.title: Shema Series - 03 Ahavah / Love
translations.description: Let's talk about love, Old Testament style! In this video we'll explore the various ways the Hebrew authors used the word \"love,\" and how they depicted God as the ultimate source and goal of all human love. This video is the third installment of our Word Studies series, a six-part exploration of the ancient biblical prayer called “The Shema.\" We will explore all of the keywords in this prayer and what they meant in their original language and historical context.

translations.title: Shema Series - 04 Lev / Heart
translations.description: Different cultures have different conceptions of the human heart, what it is and what it does, and the biblical authors are no exception. In this video we'll explore the ancient Hebrew words for \"heart\" as well as the different ideas of what our hearts represent. There is no biblical word that captures better the essence of human thought, feeling, and desire, than this rich and wonderful word. This video is the fourth installment of our Word Studies series, a six-part exploration of the ancient biblical prayer called “The Shema.\" We will explore all of the keywords in this prayer and what they meant in their original language and historical context.

translations.title: Shema Series - 05 Nephesh / Soul
translations.description: We explore the Hebrew word \"nephesh\" that often gets translated as \"soul,\" in the penultimate installment of the Shema word study series. While the English word should usually refer to a non-material essence of a human that survives after death, nephesh means something different. It is referring to humans as living, breathing, physical beings, or just to life itself. Prepare to be surprised at the biblical meaning of this fascinating word!

translations.description: Habakkuk struggles to understand God's goodness in the midst of such evil and injustice in the world.

translations.title: Read Scripture - 38 Zephaniah
translations.description: Zephaniah announces God’s purifying judgment on Israel. It will remove evil and open up a new future where all people can flourish in peace.

translations.title: Read Scripture - 39 Haggai
translations.description: Haggai challenges Israel after the exile to remain faithful to their God and rebuild the temple.

translations.title: Read Scripture - 40 Zechariah
translations.description: Zechariah's visions foster hope in the future promise of the messianic kingdom, and challenge Israel after the exile to remain faithful to God.

translations.title: Read Scripture - 41 Malachi
translations.description: Malachi accuses Israel of selfishness after the exile and announces that the day of the Lord will purify Israel and prepare them for God's kingdom.

translations.title: Read Scripture - 42 Matthew 1-13
translations.description: Jesus brings God’s heavenly kingdom to earth and invites his disciples into a new way of life through his death and resurrection.

translations.title: Read Scripture - 43 Matthew 14-28
translations.description: Jesus brings God’s heavenly kingdom to earth and invites his disciples into a new way of life through his death and resurrection.

translations.title: Read Scripture - 44 Mark
translations.description: Mark demonstrates that Jesus is Israel's messiah who inaugurates God’s kingdom through his suffering, death, and resurrection.

translations.title: Read Scripture - 45 Luke 1-9
translations.description: Jesus carries the covenant story of God and Israel to its culmination and he announces the good news of God’s kingdom to the poor and the rich.

translations.title: Read Scripture - 46 Luke 10-24
translations.description: Jesus carries the covenant story of God and Israel to its culmination and he announces the good news of God’s kingdom to the poor and the rich.

translations.title: Read Scripture - 47 John 1-12
translations.description: Jesus becomes human as the incarnation of the creator God of Israel, to share His love and the gift of eternal life with the world.

translations.title: Read Scripture - 48 John 13-21
translations.description: Jesus becomes human as the incarnation of the creator God of Israel, to share His love and the gift of eternal life with the world.

translations.title: Read Scripture - 49 Acts 1-12
translations.description: Jesus sends the Holy Spirit to empower his disciples as they carry the good news of his kingdom to the nations of the world.

translations.title: Read Scripture - 50 Acts 13-28
translations.description: Jesus sends the Holy Spirit to empower his disciples as they carry the good news of his kingdom to the nations of the world.

translations.title: Read Scripture - 51 Romans 1-4
translations.description: Paul shows how Jesus created the new covenant family of Abraham through his death and resurrection and the sending of the Spirit.

translations.title: Read Scripture - 52 Romans 5-16
translations.description: Paul shows how Jesus created the new covenant family of Abraham through his death and resurrection and the sending of the Spirit.

translations.title: Read Scripture - 53 Paul's First Letter to the Corinthians
translations.description: Paul shows the new Christians in Corinth that all of life's most complex problems can be seen through the lens of the gospel.

translations.title: Read Scripture - 54 2 Corinthians
translations.description: Paul resolves his conflict with the Corinthians by showing how the scandal of the crucifixion turns our value systems upside-down.

translations.title: Read Scripture - 55 Galatians
translations.description: Paul challenges the Galatian Christians to stop allowing controversial Torah observances to divide their church's congregation.

translations.title: Read Scripture - 56 Ephesians
translations.description: Paul shows how the good news should create ethnically diverse communities that are unified by devotion to Jesus and to each other.

translations.title: Read Scripture - 57 Philippians
translations.description: Paul thanks the Philippian Christians for their generosity and shares how they are all called to imitate Jesus’ self-giving love.

translations.title: Read Scripture - 58 Colossians
translations.description: Paul encourages the Colossian Christians to see Jesus as the center of all reality, so they don’t give in to pressure from other religions.

translations.title: Read Scripture - 59 1 Thessalonians
translations.description: Paul directs the persecuted Thessalonian Christians to hope in the future of king Jesus' return who will make all things right.

translations.title: Read Scripture - 60 2 Thessalonians
translations.description: Paul clarified his earlier teachings about Jesus' future return and rebukes the Christians who were disrupting the community.

translations.title: Read Scripture - 61 1 Timothy
translations.description: Paul shows Timothy how to restore order and purpose to the church in Ephesus which has been disrupted by false teachers.

translations.title: Read Scripture - 62 2 Timothy
translations.description: Paul is near execution, and offers a personal challenge to Timothy to keeping following Jesus no matter the sacrifice and risk.

translations.title: Read Scripture - 63 Titus
translations.description: Paul commissions Titus to show how the good news of Jesus and the power of the Spirit can transform Cretan culture from within.

translations.title: Read Scripture - 64 Philemon
translations.description: Paul helps his friend Philemon to reconcile with his escaped former slave Onesimus, and shows that they are equals because of Jesus.

translations.title: Read Scripture - 65 Letter to the Hebrews
translations.description: The author shows how Jesus is the ultimate revelation of God's love and mercy and is worthy of our devotion.

translations.title: Read Scripture - 66 James
translations.description: James combines the wisdom of his brother Jesus with the book of Proverbs in his own challenging call to live a life wholly devoted to God.

translations.title: Read Scripture - 67 1 Peter
translations.description: Peter offers hope to persecuted Christians and guides them with practical instruction on living life consistent with following Jesus.

translations.title: Read Scripture - 68 2 Peter
translations.description: Peter calls for faithfulness and confronts corrupt teachers who distorted the message about Jesus and lead others astray.

translations.title: Read Scripture - 69 1-3 John
translations.description: John calls followers of Jesus to share in God's own life and love by devoting themselves to loving one another.

translations.title: Read Scripture - 70 Jude
translations.description: Jude confronts corrupt teachers who distort the message about his brother Jesus and lead others astray.

translations.title: Read Scripture - 71 Revelation 1-11
translations.description: John's visions reveal that Jesus has overcome evil by his death and resurrection, and will return one day as the true king of the world.

translations.title: Read Scripture - 72 Revelation 12-22
translations.description: John's visions reveal that Jesus has overcome evil by his death and resurrection, and will return one day as the true king of the world.

translations.title: Read the Bible - 01 What is the Bible?
translations.description: This is episode 1 of an ongoing series that explores the origins, content, and purpose of the Bible. Here you'll be introduced to some of the basic skills necessary for reading the bible effectively.

translations.title: Read the Bible - 02 The Story of the Bible
translations.description: In this video we summarize the overall story of the Bible as a series of crossroad decisions. All humanity, followed by the Israelites, redefine good and evil and end up in Babylon. They are followed by Jesus, who takes a different path that opens up the way to a new creation.

translations.title: Read the Bible - 03 Literary Styles in the Bible
translations.description: Reading the Bible wisely requires that we learn about the ancient literary styles used by the biblical authors. These writers expressed their ideas and claims through a variety of different type of literature, and this video will explore why it's important to tell them apart so we can hear their message on their terms.

translations.title: Read the Bible - 04 The Bible as Jewish Meditation Literature
translations.description: Reading the Bible wisely requires that we learn about the ancient literary styles used by the biblical authors. The Bible is a dense book that is often difficult to read. But what if the very features that make it challenging are actually invitations to a lifetime of meditation? In this video we'll see how the Bible is the original meditation literature.

translations.title: Read the Bible - 05 Plot in Biblical Narrative
translations.description: An important part of reading biblical narratives is learning how to understand the nature of \"the plot,\" how stories are arranged into a pattern of conflict and resolution. In this video we'll see how ignoring the sequence of the plot can lead to distorted interpretation of biblical stories. We'll also explore how grasping the multi-layered nature of the narrative can help you see the unified story that leads to Jesus.

translations.title: Torah Series -01 The Book of Genesis Overview - Part 1 of 2
translations.description: The Book of Genesis can be broken up in two parts. The first part, chapters 1-11, trace the story of God and the whole world from creation all the way to the tower of Babel.

translations.title: Torah Series -02 The Book of Genesis Overview - Part 2 of 2
translations.description: God makes a promise to a man named Abram that all nations of the earth will be blessed through his family. The second half of the book of Genesis follows this man's family for four generations.

translations.title: Torah Series -03 The Book of Exodus Overview - Part 1 of 2
translations.description: The Book the first half of the book of Exodus is the story of Moses leading Israel out of Egypt. It is the first place the words \"Redemption\" and \"Salvation\" are used in the Bible. Find out how this epic story fits into the entire Biblical Narrative.

translations.title: Torah Series -04 The Book of Exodus Overview - Part 2 of 2
translations.description: In the 2nd half of Exodus Israel meets God at Mt. Sinai. They make a covenant with him, receive rules by which to live, build a tabernacle where God will dwell with them, but things go terribly wrong.

translations.title: Torah Series -05 The Book of Leviticus Overview
translations.description: Leviticus is difficult to read, but its core message is amazing: God graciously provides a way for sinful, broken people to live near his holy presence so they can find wholeness and life.

translations.title: Torah Series -06 The Book of Numbers
translations.description: The book of Numbers is Israel's epic road trip through the wilderness on their way to the promised land.

translations.title: Torah Series -07 The Book of Deuteronomy
translations.description: Moses delivers his final words of warning and wisdom to the Israelites before they enter the promised land. This is the epic conclusion of the Torah! And, spoiler alert: Moses dies.

translations.title: Gospel Series - 01 The Gospel According to Mark
translations.description: One of the earliest official accounts of the life, death, and resurrection of Jesus. Mark addresses the basic questions of whether Jesus was the true messiah for whom Israel had been waiting. And if so, what kind of Messianic king was he if he suffered and died?

translations.title: Gospel Series - 02 The Birth of Jesus - Gospel of Luke Ch 1-2
translations.description: The first in a five-part series on the Gospel of Luke. We explore the amazing events surrounding the birth of Jesus. The humble conditions of his family and their low status in Israelite society foreshadow the upside-down nature of Jesus’ kingdom.

translations.title: Gospel Series - 03 Gospel of Luke Ch. 3-9
translations.description: The Gospel of Luke Part 2 (ch. 3-9): Jesus begins his mission of announcing the good news of God’s kingdom to the poor among Israel. He is identified as the royal son of God at the beginning and end of this section, and then he starts his journey to Jerusalem where he will be enthroned as king, but not in the way anyone expects.

translations.title: Gospel Series - 04 Gospel of Luke Ch. 9-19
translations.description: In this video we explore the central part of Luke’s Gospel which recounts Jesus’ long road-trip to Jerusalem. He continues his controversial announcement of good news for the poor, which increases his conflict with Israel’s religious leaders. This tension provides the setting for the famous parable of the Prodigal Son in which Jesus summarizes what he is all about.

translations.title: Gospel Series - 05 Gospel of Luke Ch. 19-23
translations.description: The final week of Jesus' life culminated in a controversial week in Jerusalem during Passover. In this video we'll explore the Gospel of Luke chs. 19-23, and how it came about that the innocent Jesus ended up being executed as a revolutionary rebel against Rome. We'll also see how Jesus was not at all surprised, because he believed that his death would open up a new future for Israel, and for all humanity.

translations.title: Gospel Series - 06 Luke Ch. 24
translations.description: This video concludes Luke's epic portrait of Jesus of Nazareth. The disciples discover the empty tomb and eventually have their entire view of the world turned upside-down as they meet the risen Jesus. Luke shows how Jesus' kingdom of God mission to its climactic moment, and he sets the stage for its continuation in Luke's second volume, Acts.

translations.title: Wisdom Series - 01 The Book of Proverbs
translations.description: This book is the accumulation of wisdom from generations of godly insightful people. It promotes a life of virtue and “fear of the Lord,” so that you can truly experience the good life. Proverbs is one of the three books that explore these themes of biblical wisdom.

translations.title: Wisdom Series - 02 The Book of Ecclesiastes
translations.description: In this book we hear the skeptical voice of “the teacher.” He observes that living by the book of Proverbs doesn’t always bring positive results. Sometimes life is hard and defies neat explanations. How do you live with that tension, and still strive for wisdom? Ecclesiastes is the second of the biblical wisdom books.

translations.title: Wisdom Series - 03 The Book of Job
translations.description: How do you trust God even when life isn’t fair and you suffer for no good reason? Job’s story invites us to consider what it means that God runs the world by wisdom, and how this truth can bring peace in dark times. Job is the last of the three books that explore these themes of biblical wisdom.

translations.title: Themes - 01 Covenants
translations.description: God entered into a series of formal relationships with various human partners in order to ultimately rescue the world through Jesus.

translations.title: Themes - 02 Day of the Lord
translations.description: The Day of the Lord explores how God is on a mission to confront human evil, and the more mysterious spiritual evil that underlies it.

translations.title: Themes - 03 Gospel of the Kingdom
translations.description: Jesus brought God’s rule and reign to the world in a very upside-down way, which is the best news you could ever hope to hear.

translations.title: Themes - 04 Heaven & Earth
translations.description: Heaven and earth were meant to overlap, and Jesus is on a mission to bring them together once and for all.

translations.title: Themes - 05 Holiness
translations.description: The holy God is unique and set-apart as the Creator of all reality. And this God wants to invite all people into his purifying holiness so they can experience true life.

translations.title: Themes - 06 Holy Spirit
translations.description: God’s Spirit is personally present in all of creation and is sent out to Jesus' followers to bring about the new creation.

translations.title: Themes - 07 Image of God
translations.description: Jesus opens up a new way of being the image bearers of God through his life, death, and resurrection.

translations.title: Themes - 08 The Law
translations.description: The laws in the Old Testament are part of the Bible’s larger story that leads to Jesus. In him we are freed from our own selfishness to love God and our neighbor.

translations.title: Themes - 09 The Messiah
translations.description: Jesus fulfilled the ancient biblical promise of a wounded victor who would rescue humanity. He was the one who overcame evil itself by allowing it to destroy him.

translations.title: Themes - 10 Sacrifice & Atonement
translations.description: God’s “covering” over human evil through animal sacrifices ultimately point to Jesus and his death and resurrection.

translations.title: Themes - 11 Public Reading of Scripture
translations.description: Reading the Bible out loud is an ancient practice that offers us an example for a different way of engaging the Scriptures.

translations.title: Themes - 12 Justice
translations.description: What is justice and who gets to define it? Explore the biblical theme of Justice and discover how it's deeply rooted in the storyline of the Bible that leads to Jesus.

translations.title: Shema Series - 01 Listen
translations.description: The first installment of our new Word Studies series is a six-part exploration of the ancient biblical prayer called “The Shema” (found in Deuteronomy 6:4-6). For thousands of years Jewish people have daily prayed these words which summarize the Bible’s call for faithfulness and devotion to God. We will explore all of the key words in this prayer and what they meant in their original language and historical context.

translations.title: Shema Series - 02 YHWH / LORD
translations.description: The second installment of our Word Studies series is a six-part exploration of the ancient biblical prayer called “The Shema” (found in Deuteronomy 6:4-6). For thousands of years Jewish people have daily prayed these words which summarize the Bible’s call for faithfulness and devotion to God. We will explore all of the key words in this prayer and what they meant in their original language and historical context.

translations.title: Shema Series - 03 Ahavah / Love
translations.description: Let's talk about love, Old Testament style! In this video we'll explore the various ways the Hebrew authors used the word \"love,\" and how they depicted God as the ultimate source and goal of all human love. This video is the third installment of our Word Studies series, a six-part exploration of the ancient biblical prayer called “The Shema.\" We will explore all of the keywords in this prayer and what they meant in their original language and historical context.

translations.title: Shema Series - 04 Lev / Heart
translations.description: Different cultures have different conceptions of the human heart, what it is and what it does, and the biblical authors are no exception. In this video we'll explore the ancient Hebrew words for \"heart\" as well as the different ideas of what our hearts represent. There is no biblical word that captures better the essence of human thought, feeling, and desire, than this rich and wonderful word. This video is the fourth installment of our Word Studies series, a six-part exploration of the ancient biblical prayer called “The Shema.\" We will explore all of the keywords in this prayer and what they meant in their original language and historical context.

translations.title: Shema Series - 05 Nephesh / Soul
translations.description: We explore the Hebrew word \"nephesh\" that often gets translated as \"soul,\" in the penultimate installment of the Shema word study series. While the English word should usually refer to a non-material essence of a human that survives after death, nephesh means something different. It is referring to humans as living, breathing, physical beings, or just to life itself. Prepare to be surprised at the biblical meaning of this fascinating word!

translations.title: Read Scripture - 01 Intro
translations.description: In 2016 we released a new Read Scripture video for every book of the Bible coordinated with our reading plan. If you haven't read through the Bible before, or if you have tried and given up, we encourage you to read through with us.

translations.title: Read Scripture - 02 Genesis 1-11
translations.description: God makes a good world and commissions humans to rule it, and then they give in to evil and ruin everything.

translations.title: Read Scripture - 03 Genesis 12-50
translations.description: God promises to bless rebellious humanity through the family of Abraham, despite their constant failure and folly.

translations.title: Read Scripture - 04 Exodus 1-18
translations.description: God rescues the Israelites from slavery in Egypt and confronts the evil and injustice of Pharaoh.

translations.title: Read Scripture - 05 Exodus 19-40
translations.description: God invites the Israelites into a covenant and comes to live among them in the Tabernacle, but Israel rebels and ruins the relationship.

translations.title: Read Scripture - 06 Leviticus
translations.description: Israel’s holy God invites them to live in His presence despite their sin, through a series of rituals and sacred institutions.

translations.title: Read Scripture - 07 Numbers
translations.description: Israel travels through the wilderness on the way to the land promised to Abraham. Their repeated rebellion is met by God’s justice and mercy.

translations.title: Read Scripture - 08 Deuteronomy
translations.description: Moses gives final words of wisdom and warning before the Israelites enter the promised land, challenging them to be faithful to God.

translations.title: Read Scripture - 09 Joshua
translations.description: After Moses' death, Joshua leads Israel and they settle in the promised land currently occupied by Canaanites.

translations.title: Read Scripture - 10 Judges
translations.description: The Israelites turn away from God and face the consequences. God raises judges in cycles of rebellion, repentance, and restoration.

translations.title: Read Scripture - 11 Ruth
translations.description: An Israelite family faces tragic loss, and God uses the faithfulness of a non-Israelite woman to bring restoration into the family of David.

translations.title: Read Scripture - 12 1 Samuel
translations.description: God reluctantly raises up kings to rule the Israelites. The first is a failure, and the second, David, is a faithful replacement.

translations.title: Read Scripture - 13 2 Samuel
translations.description: David becomes God's most faithful king, but then rebels, resulting in the slow destruction of his family and kingdom.

translations.title: Read Scripture - 14 1-2 Kings
translations.description: David’s son Solomon leads Israel to greatness, only to fail and lead Israel to a civil war and ultimately towards destruction and exile.

translations.title: Read Scripture - 15 1-2 Chronicles
translations.description: Chronicles retells the entire Old Testament story, highlighting the future hope of the messianic king and a restore temple.

translations.title: Read Scripture - 16 Ezra-Nehemiah
translations.description: Many Israelites return to Jerusalem after the exile, and face some success alongside many spiritual and moral failures.

translations.title: Read Scripture - 17 Esther
translations.description: God providentially uses two exiled Israelites to rescue His people from certain doom, without any explicit mention of God or His activity!

translations.title: Read Scripture - 18 Job
translations.description: Job explores the difficult question of God's relationship to human suffering, and invites us to trust God's wisdom and character.

translations.title: Read Scripture - 19 Psalms
translations.description: The book of Psalms has been designed to be the prayer book of God's people as they wait for the Messiah and his coming kingdom.

translations.title: Read Scripture - 20 Proverbs
translations.description: The book of Proverbs invites people to live with wisdom and in the fear of the Lord in order to experience the good life.

translations.title: Read Scripture - 21 Ecclesiastes
translations.description: This book forces us to face death and random chance, and the challenges they pose to a naive belief in God’s goodness.

translations.title: Read Scripture - 22 Song of Songs
translations.description: The Song of Songs is a collection of ancient Israelite love poems that celebrates the beauty and power of God's gift of love and sexual desire.

translations.title: Read Scripture - 23 Isaiah 1-39
translations.description: Isaiah announces that God’s judgment will purify Israel and prepare his people to the coming messianic king and new Jerusalem.

translations.title: Read Scripture - 24 Isaiah 40-66
translations.description: Isaiah announces that God’s judgment will purify Israel and prepare his people to the coming messianic king and new Jerusalem.

translations.title: Read Scripture - 25 Jeremiah
translations.description: Jeremiah announces that God will judge Israel’s sins with an exile to Babylon. And then, he lives through the horror of his predictions.

translations.title: Read Scripture - 26 Lamentations
translations.description: A collection of five funeral poems offered on behalf of Jerusalem after its destruction by Babylon.

translations.title: Read Scripture - 27 Ezekiel 1-33
translations.description: Among the exiles in Babylon, Ezekiel shows that Israel deserved this judgment, and also that God’s justice creates hope for the future.

translations.title: Read Scripture - 28 Ezekiel 34-48
translations.description: Among the exiles in Babylon, Ezekiel shows that Israel deserved this judgment, and also that God’s justice creates hope for the future.

translations.title: Read Scripture - 29 Daniel
translations.description: The story of Daniel motivates faithfulness despite exile in Babylon. His visions offer hope that God will bring all nations under his rule.

translations.title: Read Scripture - 30 Hosea
translations.description: Hosea accuses Israel of breaking their covenant with God, and warns them of the tragic consequences to follow.

translations.title: Read Scripture - 31 Joel
translations.description: Joel reflects on the \"Day of the Lord\" and how true repentance will bring about the great restoration hoped for in the other prophetic books.

translations.title: Read Scripture - 32 Amos
translations.description: Amos accuses Israel of breaking their covenant with God, and highlights how their idolatry has led to injustice and the neglect of the poor.

translations.title: Read Scripture - 33 Obadiah
translations.description: Obadiah announces Edom's downfall to Babylon, which is an image of how God will bring down all arrogant and violent nations.

translations.title: Read Scripture - 34 Jonah
translations.description: A subversive story about a rebellious prophet who despises his God for loving his enemies.

translations.title: Read Scripture - 35 Micah
translations.description: Micah announces that God's justice is coming in order to create a new future of love and faithfulness on the other side of Israel's sin and exile.

translations.title: Read Scripture - 36 Nahum
translations.description: Nahum portrays the downfall of Nineveh and Assyria as an image of how God will confront and bring down all violent human empires.

translations.description: Habakkuk struggles to understand God's goodness in the midst of such evil and injustice in the world.
